title: Flacco savors Bengals' victory after uncertainty
content: Following his benching in Cleveland and his trade to Cincinnati, Joe Flacco said the opportunity to lead the Bengals to a comeback win was "pretty special."

title: Fiery Scherzer helps Jays tie up series with M's
content: Max Scherzer, making his first start of the postseason, led Toronto over Seattle on Thursday night to even the ALCS at two games apiece.

title: Dodgers roll in G3, near repeat World Series trip
content: Tommy Edman hit a tiebreaking single off hard-throwing rookie Jacob Misiorowski in a two-run sixth inning, and the Dodgers beat the Brewers 3-1 on Thursday to take a 3-0 lead in the NL Championship Series.

title: Cignetti gets new 8-year, $93M deal at Indiana
content: Indiana announced a new eight-year contract with coach Curt Cignetti worth nearly $93 million Thursday.

title: Parsons calls out one-sided officiating, tush push
content: Micah Parsons made his feelings known Thursday on offensive players getting away with holding far too often and his disdain for the Eagles' tush push play.

title: Amid rumors, Saints' Kamara wants to stay put
content: Saints running back Alvin Kamara and wide receiver Chris Olave were asked about the rampant trade rumors surrounding them Thursday.

title: 49ers' Kittle: 'Fully plan' to return vs. Falcons
content: George Kittle, who has been out with a hamstring injury since the season opener, said he plans to play Sunday when San Francisco hosts Atlanta.

title: Phillies' brass hopes Harper can be 'elite' again
content: Phillies president of baseball operations Dave Dombrowski wonders if two-time NL MVP Bryce Harper can return to "elite" form with six years left on his 13-year, $330 million deal.

content: Kane has always been an elite goal scorer, but in his third season with Bayern Munich, he has taken his game to a whole new level.

content: Amorim has leaned more on Mount this season, and Mount is showing just what this club has been missing.

content: As an Oct. 20 deadline looms, here's everything you need to know about the biggest potential NBA rookie contract extension decisions that have yet to unfold.

content: ESPN MMA experts make their predictions and give betting tips for UFC Fight Night from Vancouver, British Columbia.

content: Tyson Fury said he wants to return to boxing next year, so which opponents should Fury consider and why?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Dortmund center back Nico Schlotterbeck
content: Liverpool are prepared to pursue Borussia Dortmund center back Nico Schlotterbeck. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Justin Jefferson acts as photographer, pranks Vikings GM Kwesi Adofo-Mensah
content: The Minnesota Vikings star wide receiver was disguised as a veteran photographer pranking Vikings general manager Kwesi Adofo-Mensah.

title: Talent, emotional intelligence and a lifetime of sacrifice have made Oscar Piastri a F1 title favorite
content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

title: Bubba Wallace's son has helped turn his dad's NASCAR career (and life) around
content: Bubba Wallace used to find little enjoyment at the racetrack, starved for NASCAR success. Since the birth of his son, though, that has all changed.

title: Experts identify one player they feel differently about compared with common narrative
content: Our experts identify one player they feel differently about compared to the common narrative heading into the NBA season.

title: ‚ÄòNever gave anaesthesia‚Äô: Cops probe another woman's role in Bengaluru doctor‚Äôs murder
content: A surgical resident, Dr. Mahendra Reddy G S, has been arrested and remanded in custody for the alleged murder of his wife, dermatologist Dr. Kritika M Reddy. He is accused of administering an anaesthetic overdose, with forensic reports confirming the presence of Propofol in her viscera. Investigators are examining his motive and how he procured the drug.

title: Dense forests no longer safe for Naxals; over 200 Maoists lay down arms
content: Over 200 Maoists, including key figures, surrendered in Chhattisgarh's Bastar, marking a significant turning point in the fight against Naxalism. Union Home Minister Amit Shah declared Abujhmarh and North Bastar free from Naxal terror, attributing the success to the government's dual approach of pressure and surrender incentives.

title: Gwalior hospital: Worms found in govt-supplied kids‚Äô Azithromycin syrup
content: In a startling turn of events, authorities in Madhya Pradesh have issued a statewide warning following the alarming discovery of worms in a government-provided antibiotic syrup intended for children. Health officials have immediately ceased the distribution of the implicated Azithromycin Oral Suspension and have launched an extensive investigation.

title: 'Fake news': Virat Kohli's brother on Instagram; hits out at 'misinformation'
content: Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas, sarcastically addressed rampant misinformation and fake news circulating online. This social media post emerged amidst reports suggesting the cricketer and his wife, Anushka Sharma, were planning a permanent move to the UK, even transferring power of attorney for their Gurugram property.

title: Code Red at Google: ChatGPT beat Google; Sundar Pichai recalls
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai revealed an internal "code red" following OpenAI's ChatGPT launch, prompting founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin to return. The company dramatically reshaped its AI strategy, launching Bard (now Gemini) and reassigning over 20 AI initiatives to counter the existential threat to its search empire.

title: MrBeast meets Bollywood trio SRK, Salman and Aamir
content: Internet sensation MrBeast, also known as Jimmy Donaldson, has ignited a frenzy with a picture alongside Bollywood titans Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Aamir Khan in Saudi Arabia. His cryptic caption, "Hey India, should we all do something together?", has fans buzzing with speculation about a massive upcoming collaboration, potentially uniting global and Indian entertainment.

title: Hayden on India captaincy - 'Rohit becomes vulnerable because of ... '
content: Former Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden shared his thoughts on Rohit Sharma's ODI captaincy change. He noted the selectors' focus on age and the strategic move to bring Shubman Gill into leadership. Hayden highlighted the immense experience of Rohit and Virat Kohli returning for the Australian series. He also emphasized India's balanced team composition, blending youth and experience.

title: Indian pharma eyes Russian market: Firms explore localised production
content: Indian pharmaceutical companies are exploring opportunities to establish production facilities across Russia, with productive negotiations underway for joint ventures. This move aims to leverage India's expertise and Russia's market potential, fostering self-sufficiency in pharmaceuticals and other key sectors through complementary strengths.

title: Deloitte's global AI leader warns: Job loss to AI is ‚Äòinevitable‚Äô, but engineers should‚Ä¶
content: Deloitte's Nitin Mittal advises engineers not to fear AI itself, but colleagues adept at using it. While acknowledging job impacts in areas like coding and customer support, he stresses that AI primarily augments roles, not replaces them entirely. Mittal urges adaptation and reskilling for the emerging AI economy, which promises new, unimagined opportunities and requires local innovation for India.

title: 'Rammed vehicle into wall': Suicide attack on Pak army's camp; viral video shows huge blast
content: A deadly suicide attack struck a Pakistan military camp in North Waziristan on Friday, killing seven soldiers. Terrorists attempted to storm the facility, with one detonating an explosives-laden vehicle. This incident follows intense clashes between Pakistan and Afghanistan. A fragile ceasefire is now in place, brokered by the Afghan Taliban regime.

title: Gujarat cabinet reshuffle: Surat MLA Harsh Sanghavi takes oath as deputy CM; see full list
content: Gujarat BJP conducted a major cabinet reshuffle, with 16 ministers resigning and a new 26-member cabinet sworn in, including Deputy Chief Minister Harsh Sanghavi. This significant change comes ahead of crucial local body elections and nearly three years into Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel's current term.

title: Explained: Where is the Asia Cup trophy? When and how will India get it?
content: Despite winning the Asia Cup 2025, India has not received their trophy due to a controversy involving ACC president Mohsin Naqvi. The silverware remains locked in the ACC office after India declined to accept it from Naqvi, who insists on presenting it personally. A resolution is expected at an upcoming ACC meeting.

title: Happy Diwali 2025: Top 60 wishes, messages to light up the celebrations
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, is celebrated with great fervor, symbolizing hope, knowledge, and love. Families gather to share happiness, exchange gifts, and create lasting memories. The article provides 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to help express gratitude and spread joy during this auspicious occasion.

title: Total Chess World Championship Tour: No freestyle? No women's edition
content: FIDE has approved the "Total Chess World Championship Tour," a new format by Norway Chess, combining Fast Classical, Rapid, and Blitz to find the "Total Chess Player."  The tour, featuring four events annually with a $2.7 million prize pool, aims to innovate chess. A pilot event is set for autumn 2026, with the full season in 2027.

title: Why Maccabi Tel Aviv fans were banned from Europa League match at Aston Villa
content: Maccabi Tel Aviv fans are banned from attending their Europa League match against Aston Villa due to security concerns, including threats of antisemitic attacks and protests. This decision, supported by West Midlands Police, has drawn criticism from political and Jewish organizations, highlighting the growing politicization of sports events and the need to balance fan safety with access.

title: 3rd attack in 4 months: Why gangsters are targeting Kapil Sharma's Canada caf√©
content: In a troubling escalation, Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Canada has been targeted for the third time, this time captured in a shocking video showing a vehicle firing at the venue. Adding to the tension, a post on social media, linked to associates of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, threatened retaliation against debtors and critics alike.

title: Bengaluru: Student raped inside engineering college's men's washroom
content: A shocking incident unfolded at a private college in Bengaluru where a 21-year-old engineering student was arrested for allegedly raping a female classmate in a men's washroom. The alleged assault occurred on October 10th, with the survivor filing a complaint five days later.

title: IRCTC tatkal: Last-minute trip plan in festive season? Top points on ticket booking
content: Indian Railways braces for a surge in passengers during Diwali and Chhath, especially in Northern India. Securing Tatkal tickets remains a challenge due to high demand. Advance preparation, utilizing IRCTC's master list, quick payment options, and exploring alternative trains are key strategies for travelers. The article outlines a step-by-step booking process for Tatkal tickets.

title: Diwali 2025 Rangoli designs: Stunning ideas to brighten up your festivities
content: Diwali 2025 approaches with vibrant rangoli designs. Explore flower, diya, geometric, and peacock themes. Add glitter, stones, or religious motifs for auspiciousness. Discover layered, eco-friendly, 3D, and personalized creations. Tips for perfect rangoli include planning, quality materials, starting from the center, and using lights. Brighten your home with these festive floor art ideas.

title: ‚ÄòForging court orders, judges‚Äô signatures‚Äô: SC flags rise in digital arrest scams
content: The Supreme Court has taken serious note of rising digital arrests across India, seeking a response from the government and CBI. This action follows a case where a senior citizen couple was digitally arrested using forged court orders, leading to extortion. The apex court emphasized that such fabrications undermine public trust in judicial institutions and require coordinated efforts to combat.

title: Hidden signs of Vitamin B12 deficiency that mimic depression and ageing
content: Fatigue, forgetfulness, and tingling hands? You might be low on Vitamin B12. This deficiency is widespread in India and often mistaken for stress, ageing, or even depression.

title: 'You don't know who the trainer is': Maharashtra BJP MLA tells Hindu girls to avoid gyms
content: In a provocative statement, BJP's MLA Gopichand Padalkar has stirred debate by recommending that Hindu college women practice yoga in the comfort of their homes. He alleges a 'big conspiracy' aimed at disrupting traditional values, expressing worries about the influence of gym trainers.

title: Why Trump strike on 'narcoterrorists' in Caribbean could become a legal headache for the US
content: On Thursday, the US military launched another strike against what it described as a suspected drug vessel in the Caribbean. But unlike previous operations ‚Äî all of which ended with the total destruction of boats and the deaths of everyone on board ‚Äî this one left survivors, a US official confirmed to Reuters. It‚Äôs unclear whether the survivors were rescued, if they‚Äôre receiving medical aid, or whether they are now in US custody ‚Äî possibly as prisoners of war. The Pentagon has not commented.

title: India cut Russian oil imports by 50%? After Trump, White House makes big claim
content: Indian refiners are reportedly set to halve their Russian oil imports, a White House official stated. However, Indian sources suggest this reduction hasn't materialized yet, with December/January data expected to show any change. Meanwhile, the Ministry of External Affairs denied any recent conversation between PM Modi and US President Trump regarding this matter, emphasizing India's consumer-centric energy policy.

title: Diwali 2025: Is school holiday on 20th or 21st October?
content: Diwali 2025 school holidays: Diwali 2025 falls on October 20, but school holiday dates vary across states and boards. While most CBSE and ICSE schools have declared a holiday on October 20, some regions may extend the break to October 21 for Govardhan Puja. The confusion arises due to state-specific calendars and local observances. Parents and students are advised to check with their respective schools for the exact schedule, as some institutions may follow different timelines.

title: UAE to hold prayer for rain today: Here‚Äôs when, where and how to participate
content: Mosques across the UAE are holding a special prayer for rain today, following President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed's call. The Salat al-IstisqƒÅ, a powerful act of faith, takes place around 30 minutes before the regular Friday prayer. Leaders and citizens will unite in supplication, seeking divine mercy and blessings for the nation.

title: UP lynching case: Rahul meets Dalit victim's family; claims govt 'threatening' them
content: Rahul Gandhi visited the family of Hariom Valmiki, a Dalit man lynched in Raebareli. Gandhi alleged the government threatened the family against meeting him. He pledged Congress support for Dalits facing atrocities nationwide. Gandhi stated the family seeks justice and accused the government of obstructing their access to medical care and protection for perpetrators.

title: Cash, luxury watches & more: How bribe trap led CBI to IPS officer's opulent life
content: A senior IPS officer, Ropar Range DIG Harcharan Singh Bhullar, has been arrested by the CBI. He was apprehended at his Mohali office on bribery charges. An iron merchant had complained of a Rs 8 lakh demand to settle a case. The CBI also seized significant cash, jewellery, luxury watches, and property documents during searches.

title: Delhi: Thar driver runs over teen twice; kills him
content: A 13-year-old boy, Murshid, was tragically killed after being allegedly run over twice by a Mahindra Thar in Vasant Kunj, Delhi. Eyewitnesses reported the SUV driver hit the boy on his bicycle and then reversed over him before fleeing the scene. The victim's family, living in a jhuggi, mourns his loss and seeks justice.

title: Diwali 2025: Festival calendar, dates, significance and muhurat guide
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance. Celebrated over five days starting October 18, 2025, it honors Lord Rama's return and Goddess Lakshmi's blessings. The main Lakshmi Puja occurs on October 20, with specific auspicious timings for prayers.

title: ‚ÄòYou are a pig Trump‚Äô: Hackers breach several airports in US, Canada
content: Public address systems and display screens at four North American airports were compromised, broadcasting pro-Hamas messages and anti-Trump sentiments. The cyberattacks targeted Harrisburg International Airport in Pennsylvania, and Windsor, Kelowna, and Victoria International Airports in Canada. While authorities deemed the overall disruption minimal, investigations are underway to address the security breach and its potential implications.

title: Nara Lokesh takes 'feeling the burn' jibe; Priyank Kharge hits back
content: Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh IT ministers are locked in a verbal spat over Google's proposed $15 billion AI data center. Karnataka's minister criticized Andhra Pradesh's substantial subsidies, deeming it an "economic disaster." Andhra's minister playfully retorted, suggesting Karnataka was feeling the "burn" of their successful investment attraction.

title: BCCI budget: Board expects to retain net surplus of 6700 crore
content: Hosting the Asia Cup will boost the BCCI's coffers by over Rs 100 crore, contributing to an expected net surplus of Rs 6700 crore for 2025-26. Despite a slump in IPL valuation, the board's surplus has grown significantly, though future growth may slow.  Expenditure on women's domestic cricket remains considerably lower than men's.

title: After weak opening, Nifty soars above 25,750; Sensex up by over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday after days of strong rallying. While Nifty50 was below 25,550, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: CBSE practical exams 2025: Winter-bound school schedule out; check dates here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has announced the practical exam schedule for Classes 10 and 12 in winter-bound schools for the 2025‚Äì26 session. As per the circular, practical, project, and internal assessments will be held from November 6 to December 6, 2025. The schedule applies only to winter-bound schools; others will follow later dates.

title: Ex-US envoy to India Richard Verma appointed as independent director at T Rowe Price
content: Former US Ambassador to India, Richard R. Verma, has rejoined the T. Rowe Price board as an independent director. His extensive experience in diplomacy, corporate leadership, and public policy will enhance the firm's governance and strategic discussions. This appointment, alongside Allan Golston, reflects T. Rowe Price's commitment to diverse expertise.

title: Fact check: Did Virat Kohli sign a Pakistan jersey on reaching Perth?
content: A viral social media image falsely depicted Virat Kohli signing a Pakistan jersey. Fact-checking revealed the image was digitally altered; Kohli actually signed a Royal Challengers Bengaluru jersey for a fan in Perth, Australia. The Indian cricket team is currently in Perth preparing for their upcoming ODI and T20I series against Australia.

title: Rise and Fall winner: Arjun Bijlani lifts the trophy of the reality show
content: Pawan Singh's grand finale performance and Ashneer Grover's wit entertained fans, while Arjun Bijlani emerged victorious in the "penthouse and pace" reality show.  Bijlani's journey, marked by challenges and emotional moments, resonated with viewers who celebrated his inspiring and entertaining win on social media.

title: Hindu and Jewish leaders unite for seven-city US tour against rising hate
content: Hindu and Jewish leaders embarked on a seven-city US speaking tour to combat rising discrimination and strengthen interfaith ties. Organized by HinduACTion, the initiative provided practical tools to counter disinformation and marginalization, fostering dialogue and collaborative strategies between the communities.

title: Anesthesia murder: Kritika‚Äôs family donates her house for spiritual activities
content: Grief-stricken by their daughter Kritika's mysterious death, her family has donated their Bengaluru home to ISKCON, seeking peace and positive energy. The 28-year-old dermatologist's husband, a gastroenterologist, is under investigation after a post-mortem revealed anaesthesia in her system. He remains tight-lipped about the events leading to her demise.

title: 'Will fulfil all his dreams': 8-year-old son lights ASI Sandeep pyre
content: ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather, who died by suicide, was cremated in his native Julana town after his family demanded an FIR against named individuals. The FIR was lodged, leading to the postmortem and cremation attended by prominent political figures. His family expressed anguish, calling him wronged and demanding justice.

title: ‚ÄòUnhinged‚Äô wolf warrior: US treasury secy slams China‚Äôs trade negotiator
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent labelled a senior Chinese trade official 'unhinged' and a 'wolf warrior' for aggressive behaviour during what he claimed was an uninvited visit to Washington. China's Commerce Ministry refuted the claims, stating the visit aimed for discussions following presidential talks.

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Probe team arrests 'sponsor' Unnikrishnan
content: Sabarimala gold theft prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti has been taken into custody for detailed interrogation by a special investigation team. Investigators are probing the alleged handover of stolen gold to a Bengaluru-based man. The probe, which has a six-week deadline, is expected to reveal the exact quantity of misappropriated gold.

title: California at risk? Scientists warns an earthquake could strike and cause huge damage
content: A massive Pacific Northwest earthquake could trigger a devastating second quake on California's San Andreas Fault, a new study reveals. This challenges previous beliefs of fault independence, suggesting a dangerous domino effect. Such interconnected seismic activity poses significant risks to the US West Coast, underscoring the urgent need for enhanced preparedness and infrastructure.

title: Muhammad Yunus Calls On Parties To Sign Charter Deciding Bangladesh's Future
content: Several major political parties in Bangladesh will sign the much-discussed July National Charter 2025 on Friday, a document meant to form a consensus on the path to democratic renewal.

title: "Return To Your I Hate India Tour": US Singer Mary Millben Jabs Rahul Gandhi
content: US singer Mary Millben's remarks came a day after Rahul Gandhi, in a post on X, said PM Modi is "frightened of Donald Trump".

title: "India To Receive One Aircraft Per Week Next Decade": GE Aerospace CEO
content: As aspirational India continues to grow, India will receive one aircraft per week or more in the next decade, said Vikram Rai, GE Aerospace CEO (South Asia), as he highlighted the massive strides in the Indian aviation industry.

title: MK Stalin Announces Commission To Frame Law Against Dishonour Killings In Tamil Nadu
content: "We cannot allow our youth to be killed in the name of caste or family honour. This government will not remain a silent spectator," MK Stalin told Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly.

title: "No Foul Play Suspected": Singapore Police On Zubeen Garg's Death
content: According to the Singapore police, the completion of the investigation into the death of Zubeen Garg may take up to another three months.

title: 2 Thai Men Peeing On Side Of Agra-Lucknow Expressway Run Over By Car
content: Two Thai nationals were killed in a road accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway here, police said on Friday.

title: Ex-Australia PM Tony Abbott Counters Western Media's Views On PM Modi
content: Former Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott, speaking at the NDTV World Summit 2025, took aim at what he described as "Western liberal or leftist press" narratives that have sometimes portrayed Prime Minister Narendra Modi in unflattering terms.

title: "World's Best Reserve Of Gold, Diamond In India": Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal At NDTV World Summit
content: Vedanta Group Founder and Chairman Anil Agarwal on Friday said that India holds some of the world's richest reserves of gold and diamond but has yet to tap its full potential.

title: Delhi Man Falls Into Ganga From Rishikesh Bridge, Search On
content: A 31-year-old man from New Delhi allegedly fell into the Ganga river from Bajrang Bridge, an under-construction transparent glass floor bridge, and went missing in Rishikesh, officials said on Friday.

title: Maharashtra Teen Forced Into Marriage, Raped. 5 Arrested: Cops
content: A 13-year-old tribal girl from Maharashtra's Palghar district was allegedly forcibly married off and raped, police said on Friday.

title: "Trump Misplayed His Hand With India On Tariffs": Tony Abbott At NDTV World Summit
content: US President Donald Trump misplaced his hand with India by imposing massive tariffs, said former Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott.

title: Democrats Say Trump Be Involved In Shutdown Talks. He's Shown Little Interest
content: President Donald Trump is showing little urgency to broker a compromise that would end the government shutdown, even as Democrats insist no breakthrough is possible without his direct involvement.

title: "Changing The Way Of Struggle": Top Maoist To NDTV After Laying Down Arms
content: The Bastar region, long synonymous with Maoist insurgency, witnessed a watershed moment on October 16 and 17.

title: Ex-Japanese PM Tomiichi Murayama, Known For Apology Over Wartime Aggression, Dies At 101
content: Japan's former Prime Minister Tomiichi Murayama, who was known for his 1995 "Murayama statement" apologizing to Asian victims of his country's aggression, died Friday. He was 101.

title: NDTV World Summit 2025 LIVE: India Will Receive One Aircraft Every Week In Coming Days, Says Vikram Rai
content: NDTV Global World Summit 2025 LIVE Updates: The 2025 edition of the NDTV World Summit - NDTV's flagship event - began on Friday, and will feature a host of leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: "Grave Criminal Act": Supreme Court On Rising Digital Arrest Cases
content: The Supreme Court said forging top court and high court orders and signatures of judges to digitally arrest innocent people strikes at the bottom of trust and faith of people in judicial institutions.

title: British Envoy To India Shares Identity Crisis With Gaza At NDTV World Summit
content: The Gaza issue is personal to Lindy Cameron, British High Commissioner to India, as she recalls her roots - Northern Ireland - at the NDTV World Summit 2025.

title: Will AI Take Our Jobs? Deloitte AI Leader Nitin Mittal Says Worry About This Instead
content: Instead of worrying about Artificial Intelligence (AI) taking our jobs, workers must worry about their colleagues who are adapting to AI and showing the curiosity to learn new AI models, said Deloitte's Global AI Leader Nitin Mittal.

title: Delhi Boy Sends Hoax Bomb Threat Mail To School To Avoid Exams
content: A bomb threat e-mail sent to a private school in outer Delhi turned out to be a hoax, with police tracing the sender to a student who wanted to avoid exams, officials said on Friday.

title: J&K CM Omar Abdullah reiterates demand for early restoration of statehood, says it would empower elected government
content: Omar Abdullah said one of his party colleagues has also come up with a bill on the issue of land grant, and he does not know whether that would also come up in the House or not

title: Our aim is to take domestic defence production to 100%: Rajnath Singh
content: India's defence export has reached a record ‚Çπ25,000 crore which was less than ‚Çπ1,000 crore few years ago, says Defence Minister

title: India's Russian oil import rebound in Oct after dip in previous quarter: Kpler data
content: The data pertains to the period prior to U.S. President Donald Trump's statement claiming Prime Minister Narendra Modi has agreed to stop Russian crude imports

title: Banned cough syrup worth ‚Çπ2 crore recovered from goods train in Tripura
content: During the coordinated raid, the teams successfully recovered 90,000 bottles of banned Escuf syrup from two goods train wagons stationed at Jirania railway station in West Tripura, says police

title: NIMHANS holds State-level consultation on responsible digital use among students in Karnataka
content: Participants discussed patterns of technology overuse among students, and explored preventive and promotive measures to encourage healthy and ethical technology use

title: New Gujarat Cabinet sworn in: Harsh Sanghvi named Deputy CM, Rivaba Jadeja among new faces
content: Harsh Sanghvi took oath as the Deputy Chief Minister and the youngest to hold the position in the State‚Äôs history

title: Uttarakhand High Court lifts 31-year-old ban on hiring contract workers at ONGC
content: The Centre claimed that the notification was issued following due process. However, the court found that there was no proper consultation and limited scrutiny, meaning the decision lacked sufficient factual basis.

title: Bengaluru engineering student arrested for raping senior in men‚Äôs washroom on campus
content: According to a senior police officer, the girl is a year senior to the accused, and the two had known each other for the past three months

title: Zubeen Garg‚Äôs death probe may take three months: Singapore Police
content: The country‚Äôs police force said it does not suspect foul play and advised people not to spread unverified information

title: Sabarimala artefacts misappropriation case: Court remands accused Unnkrishnan Potti to SIT custody
content: The magistrate examined the SIT‚Äôs request for Unnikrishnan Potti‚Äôs charge in camera. The judicial officer reportedly gave Mr. Potti 10 minutes to confer with his defence counsel

title: Hoax bomb threat to Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan‚Äôs residence in Chennai
content: The police swiftly responded, securing the area and carrying out extensive searches; no explosive was found on the premises, and authorities later declared the threat a hoax

title: Water bottle row: Kerala High Court sets aside KSRTC driver‚Äôs transfer
content: The transfer (from Kottayam to Thrissur) can only be treated as a colourable exercise of power, a Bench of Justice N. Nagaresh said and allowed a petition filed by Jaimon Joseph

title: Kerala High Court lifts suspension of toll collection at Paliekkara
content: The matter has not been closed, it said, while referring to traffic congestion being reported at multiple locations on the National Highway

title: Village in Maharashtra‚Äôs Beed district evacuated after cracks develop
content: ‚ÄúNearly 400 persons of 85 families lived in the village. They have been shifted to a rest house at Manmath Swami temple in the area,‚Äù said the District Collector

title: 13-year-old tribal girl from Maharashtra‚Äôs¬†Palghar forced into marriage, raped
content: The minor girl was forcibly married off in Maharashtra; police have registered a case against five persons, including the groom and his family from Ahilyanagar

title: Wild elephant nicknamed ‚ÄòRolex‚Äô captured near Coimbatore in early morning operation
content: The tusker that is believed to have killed at least four persons in the past several months was taken to the Anamalai Tiger Reserve (ATR), where it will be lodged in a kraal (wooden enclosure) at Varagaliar elephant camp

title: PDP MLA slams CM for 'slashing' RBA quota; calls it 'calculated' move to disempower Kashmiris
content: The Pulwama legislator accused Chief Minister Omar Abdullah of advancing the "disempowerment agenda" and asserted that the Residents of Backward Areas (RBA) quota safeguards Kashmiri representation

title: Artist Thota Vaikuntam brings his iconic Telangana woman to life in fibreglass sculptures
content: Master artist Thota Vaikuntam on reimagining his iconic paintings of Telangana women as fibreglass sculptures that are now displayed across India

title: India Post to roll out mail, parcel services with 24-hr, 48-hr guarantee-based delivery timelines
content: Scindia said that the government aims to transformer India Post from a 'cost centre' to a 'profit centre' by 2029

title: Supreme Court expresses ‚Äògrave concern‚Äô over rising ‚Äòdigital arrests‚Äô scams, seeks responses from Centre and CBI
content: Fraudsters armed with forged Supreme Court orders allegedly defrauded a septuagenarian woman in Ambala of over ‚Çπ1 crore, prompting the Supreme Court to call for coordinated action by Central and State authorities

title: Insulting Kharge family is like insulting our own: Dr. Ajay Singh
content: Dr. Singh said that those who despise the ideals of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar and provoke Ambedkarites with hateful remarks have already been rejected by the people, who have given the Congress party overwhelming support

title: India, Brazil agree to expand scope of existing trade pact between India-Mercosur bloc
content: The issue was discussed during a meeting between the visiting Brazilian Vice President Geraldo Alckmin and Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal

title: 1984 riots: Delhi HC to hear Sajjan Kumar‚Äôs appeal against conviction, life term in November
content: The appeal was scheduled to come up for hearing before a bench of Justices Vivek Chaudhary and Manoj Jain, which did not hold the court. The matter has now been fixed for November 19

title: Fire breaks out in Navi Mumbai unit manufacturing candles, glass items; no injuries
content: The cooling operations are underway, the official said, adding that the cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained

title: Maharashtra Government‚Äôs financial aid for farmers in Marathwada region inadequate: Sharad Pawar
content: The NCP(SP) leader said he did not want to politicise the issue but genuinely felt that everyone should make efforts to help affected farmers

title: LCA Tejas Mk1A manufactured in Nashik plant of HAL completes maiden flight
content: The Defence Minister inaugurated the third production line of the LCA Mk1A, and the second production line of the Hindustan Turbo Trainer-40 (HTT-40), which is an indigenous Basic Trainer Aircraft designed and developed by HAL for the IAF

title: IRCTC website down; travellers unable to book tickets ahead of Deepavali
content: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) website was down on Friday (October 17, 2025)

title: Scheduled Caste lynching in Raebareli: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi meets victim‚Äôs family
content: Rahul Gandhi spent about 25 minutes with the family in Fatehpur district during which he spoke with Hariom's father Gangadeen, brother Shivam, and sister Kusum and offered condolences and support

title: Climate finance must be duty, not promise: India to developed countries
content: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav spoke on climate financing at the G20 Environment Ministers‚Äô Meeting in Cape Town, South Africa

title: Kerala school hijab row: Parents decide to shift their daughter to another school
content: Parents shift their student from St. Rita‚Äôs Public School in Kochi over hijab controversy and they thanked the government for supporting the students‚Äô right to wear hijab

title: Special voter registration drive for North-East Teachers‚Äô constituency in Karnataka on October 27, 30 and November 3
content: Applications in Form-19, along with supporting documents, will be accepted during the drive at designated centres between 10 a.m. and 5.30 p.m.

title: Transgender leader held in Indore after 24 community members attempt to take their own lives
content: As per the FIR, a rival group allegedly threatened and assaulted the 24 persons when they demanded some money from a deposit collected for a community conference

title: CBI team arrives in Karur to begin probe into TVK rally stampede case
content: After receiving the case details registered by the Karur town police on September 27, the CBI team is expected to begin its investigation later on Friday

title: Confusion over cause of Anaya‚Äôs death: Family to seek legal action
content: Child father was arrested after he attacked a doctor at Thamarasseri Taluk hospital alleging his negligence

title: Three Army personnel hurt in terrorist attack in Assam
content: The terrorists fled the spot after ‚Äúcarrying out speculative firing using automatic weapons‚Äù due to retaliation by the Army, said a Defence spokesperson

title: 210 Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh, hand over 153 weapons
content: On October 16, 2025, Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that 258 Maoists had surrendered in Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra over the past two days.

title: Political tempers flare up in the campaign for Odisha bypoll
content: Taking a dig at former CM Naveen Patnaik, Odisha CM Mohan Majhi accused him of making ‚Äòfalse promises during elections‚Äô and ‚Äòconveniently forgetting them once polls were over‚Äô

title: Cooperative network strengthened in Rajasthan with membership drive
content: Minister of State for Cooperative Gautam Kumar Dak said the PACS had organised 8,500 special camps for giving membership to the people in the rural areas

title: Abhishek Banerjee launches drive to induct social media warriors to counter BJP online
content: Speaking at the launch of the initiative Abhishek Banerjee said that Bengal, our beloved motherland, is being hounded, humiliated, maligned, and vilified by Bohiragoto Bangla-Birodhi Zamindars who thrive on lies and propaganda, increasingly in the digital space.

title: ‚ÄòFake Aadhaar numbers being used to create fake voter IDs,‚Äô claims NCP-SP leader Rohit Pawar
content: Rohit Pawar gave a presentation, citing examples of addition, deletion and duplication of voters in Maharashtra‚Äôs voter list

title: Centre tells Delhi High Court OTT accessibility guidelines for hearing, visually impaired to be finalised

title: Assam Govt to seek fast-track court trial in Zubeen Garg death case
content: A Special Public Prosecutor will be appointed for the purpose in consultation with the Advocate General, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

content: The accused had allegedly demanded ‚Çπ8.000 from a 73-year-old man to issue E-swathu (digital database of property ownership in rural areas)

title: Bomb threat to Delhi school turns out to be hoax; student sent e-mail to avoid exams: Police
content: A case was registered, and during the investigation, the cyber team traced the origin of the e-mail to a juvenile

title: Proposed Hubballi-Ankola railway line unlikely to get approval from State Wildlife Board in Karnataka
content: This is in stark contrast to the recent statement of Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, who had expressed confidence of getting the necessary clearances, and that the DPR for the project would be prepared soon

title: SIT probe into anti-Maiost operations undermines federal structure of policing powers: Chhattisgarh High Court¬†¬†
content: A two-judge Bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Sinha and Judge Bibhu Datta Guru ruled that counter-insurgency measures undertaken by the State or Central Security forces, could not be subjected to investigation by the SIT unless exceptional circumstances warranted such intervention

title: Kerala‚Äôs hijab row: Explained
content: The escalating row over political and religious lines eased on October 14, 2025 after the parent agreed to adhere to the rules and regulations prescribed by the management

title: Indian convict among criminals arrested by ICE amid U.S. shutdown

title: Air India has scaled up flight services from Thiruvananthapuram: Kerala CM

title: Case registered over fake claims about electoral rolls circulating on social media
content: Election officials have urged the public not to believe or share unverified information concerning electoral rolls and have warned that strict action will be taken

title: CBI arrests Punjab DIG on graft charges; ‚Çπ5 crore cash, Mercedes, luxury watches seized
content: The CBI seized jewellery weighing about 1.5 kg, keys of two luxury vehicles (Mercedes and Audi), 22 luxury watches, locker keys, 40 litres of imported liquor

title: Bald truths: the high cost of quick-fix hair cures
content: Pop-up hair treatment camps and miracle regrowth schemes are preying on men‚Äôs insecurities, promising instant fixes but leaving a trail of burns, infections and empty wallets. Urban tragedy unfolds in Hyderabad as men fall prey to scams, revealing the emotional turmoil of baldness

content: Mr. Potti, who worked as the assistant to a TDB-appointed priest at Sabarimala in the early 2010s, had revealed that two copper-gold overlays he had donated to the temple in 2019 were missing. They were later recovered at his sister‚Äôs residence.

title: Man dies of asphyxiation while cleaning septic tank in Ranipet
content: Police say that the victim did not respond¬†after he went inside the tank; two others who tried to save the victim fell unconscious. Both of them have been admitted at a private hospital

title: UN today still reflects realities of 1945, not of 2025; it must reform: EAM Jaishankar
content: The EAM underscored the need to "recalibrate" global peacekeeping efforts in tune with evolving realities

title: Durgapur gang rape case: Bengal has second-lowest conviction rate for crimes against women
content: Between 2017 and 2023, only around one in five cases of crimes against women ended in convictions in West Bengal

title: Indian peacekeepers carved special place for themselves, earned goodwill: President Murmu
content: President Droupadi Murmu praises Indian peacekeepers for their gender inclusion, community empowerment, and dedication to United Nations peacekeeping missions

title: Know thy villain | Review of The Menon Investigation by Saharu Nusaiba Kannanari
content: In this police procedural set in Kerala, male protagonists are the victims of an unjust patriarchal society

title: Candlelight before codification: 20 years of RTI Act
content: In Beawar, Rajasthan, the birthplace of the Right to Information movement, people reckon with a looming setback while celebrating 20 years of a historic law.¬†Aroon Deep¬†finds that even as groups from across India gather to rejoice at the citizen wins, they protest its erosion in several ways, especially by the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023

title: NDA will return to power in Bihar with thumping majority: Chhattisgarh CM
content: Vishnu Deo Sai said that Bihar has witnessed tremendous growth under the leadership of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

title: Digvijaya Singh alleges SIR aimed at 'vote theft', says INDIA bloc will protest with proof
content: Singh accused the BJP of having 62 lakh voters removed from the electoral rolls in Bihar to influence assembly elections. He asserted, however, that the alliance in Bihar would still form the government.

title: What to know ahead of the U.S. Grand Prix at Austin

title: 2026 class rankings: Missouri makes move with fall signings
content: the 2026 recruiting class remains in the top 25 after the dismissal of James Franklin . programs including Arkansas, UCLA and Oklahoma State have seen their classes fall apart in the wake of coaching changes . with overall success on the field, Missouri is starting to build success on a recruiting trail as well, with multiple commitments in October .

title: WNBA mock draft: Betts, Fudd or Miles at No. 1?

title: 1st Tejas-Mk1A from Nashik completes maiden flight; gets water cannon salute ‚Äî Watch
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ.
